item.title: Legal battle begins over Virginia Giuffre’s multi-million-dollar estate
item.description: A legal battle over the reported multi-million-dollar estate of Virginia Giuffre, who was abused by US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, is underway in Western Australia.

item.title: Preparing my garden for time away in summer
item.description: Leaving my garden in the heat of summer can feel worrying but some simple planning means it misses me less than I miss it.

item.title: Struggling AFLW teams GWS, Collingwood and Gold Coast receive extra picks or list spots from league
item.description: Three of the AFLW's worst-performing clubs will receive boosts to their lists, with the help announced the day before the grand final.

item.title: Lotterywest cancels licences of seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco or vapes
item.description: Seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco and vapes have their lotteries licences terminated, as attempts to disrupt the illicit and growing trade continues.

item.title: Perth hacker Michael Clapsis jailed after setting up fake Qantas Wi-Fi, stealing sex videos
item.description: A Perth hacker who copied intimate images and sex videos from women's personal online accounts and set up fake Wi-Fi on Qantas flights is sentenced to more than seven years in prison.

item.title: Kyra Cooney-Cross scores stunning long range goal as Matildas down New Zealand 5-0
item.description: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

item.title: Hong Kong's aging towers face urgent questions after city's deadliest blaze in decades
item.description: Hong Kong's worst fire in decades exposed long-standing weaknesses in its aging residential blocks. The question haunting the city is whether the disaster could happen again.

item.title: One of seven Rosenberg's goannas from ACT reserve is missing from home for second time in two years
item.description: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

item.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA
item.description: An on-country youth diversion facility has been built in the state's far north, offering a culturally grounded alternative to traditional youth justice programs.

item.title: Qantas terminal at Melbourne Airport evacuated and flights delayed due to fire
item.description: The Qantas terminal is re-opening after being evacuated because of a small fire inside Melbourne Airport.

item.title: NT parliament hears claims of children in youth detention being transferred without families' knowledge
item.description: Two politicians allege NT children in youth detention are being moved from Alice Springs to Darwin without their families' knowledge.

item.title: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte
item.description: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

item.title: Eight arrested and 128 people dead as alarm faults confirmed in Hong Kong fire
item.description: The arrests come as the probe into what caused the deadly blaze that killed at least 128 people continues.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff Andriy Yermak quits as anti-corruption probe widens
item.description: It come as Kyiv battles to persuade US officials to defend Ukraine's interests in peace agreement talks with Russia expected to take place in the coming days.

item.title: Albanese knows the power dynamic between Labor and mining interests has shifted
item.description: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

item.title: Family, advocates welcome 'historic' police conviction over Jai Wright's death
item.description: For the family of Dunghutti teen Jai Wright, the guilty finding against police officer Benedict Bryant for dangerous driving occasioning Jai's death lifts a "weight off their shoulders". Legal experts say it's the first time a police officer has been convicted in relation to the death of a First Nations person in custody.

item.title: Growing concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver
item.description: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.

item.title: John 'Wacka' Williams labels Barnaby Joyce's resignation an 'act of treason'
item.description: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

item.title: Director Peter Weir on capturing the mood for Picnic at Hanging Rock
item.description: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

item.title: Cape Barren Island was returned for Aboriginal self-governance 20 years ago
item.description: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

item.title: Hong Kong tower residents had safety complaints more than 12 months before deadly fires
item.description: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

item.title: Normalisation of location sharing, tech-facilitated abuse in spotlight after Lilie James inquest
item.description: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

item.title: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard on quitting Spotify, orchestras, raves, and world domination
item.description: Their rock, rave and orchestral music attracts a cult global following. But the prolific, chaotic King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard are just "at peace with failing".

item.title: Social media influencers used to promote Melbourne Metro Tunnel opening
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal the Victorian government has targeted dozens of social media influencers to promote the Metro Tunnel rail project.

item.title: Lawyers warn erroneous and costly family court transcripts are impeding justice, prompting calls for change
item.description: Obtaining court transcripts can cost thousands of dollars for a single day of proceedings, but the documents can contain errors, missing text, and even wrong attribution, frustrating legal practitioners who say the flaws impede justice.

item.title: R360 launch postponed from 2026 to 2028, after players withdraw due to threats of NRL bans
item.description: Threats of long bans for prospective R360 players prompted "a handful" of them to withdraw from the rebel league, which now says it will launch in 2028 instead of next year.

item.title: Crowdy Bay shark attack highlights need for first aid devices, drone surveillance on remote beaches
item.description: A makeshift tourniquet may have made the difference between a shark attack on the NSW Mid North Coast this week claiming one life not two. The attack has put a spotlight on how fatalities may be prevented.

item.title: Australia's emissions have dropped, but we've got our work cut out to reach targets
item.description: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

item.title: Landscape around Yunta in outback SA
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and searches of mines, dams and scrub have yielded no clues
item.description: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

item.title: Adoption support service warns against increasing adoption in Queensland
item.description: Queensland should overhaul "outdated" adoption laws that sever children's legal ties to their families, while ensuring adoption remains a last resort, a peak support service tells a commission of inquiry.

item.title: World-first tournament hopes to 'break down barriers' between the golf and disability communities
item.description: People with intellectual disabilities will have roles in planning, promoting, preparing, and supporting professionals at a charity golf tournament that is the first of its kind.

item.title: Sydney Thunder miss out on WBBL win as Adelaide Strikers clash ended early by rain
item.description: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

item.title: Former premier Peter Gutwein says Hobart AFL stadium has been 'poorly' sold
item.description: Peter Gutwein initiated the push for a stadium in Hobart, but he has had to watch the drama unfold from the sidelines. He says rejecting the proposal would be the biggest "lost opportunity" in the state's history.

item.title: Former premier Peter Gutwein says he is not surprised by the 'challenging fight' over the Hobart stadium.

item.title: What would it be like to visit Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: From potential gridlock to an "immersive" viewing experience, let's set aside the politics — just for a moment — and look at what planning documents tell us about the building at the heart of Tasmania's fiery stadium debate.

item.title: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs that experts want you to consider
item.description: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

item.title: Cricket Australia set to speak with Usman Khawaja after he labelled Perth Ashes Test pitch a 'piece of shit'
item.description: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

item.title: Survivors of forced adoption in South Australia call for greater recognition
item.description: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

item.title: After suffering 'terrifying' postpartum rage, this mother wants others to know they're not alone
item.description: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

item.title: Melbourne Airport terminal fire under investigation after evacuation of Qantas domestic terminal
item.description: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

item.title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina damage exposes need for new Royal Darwin Hospital
item.description: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

item.title: Who's thriving and who's barely surviving in Australia, the Land of the Parrots?
item.description: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

item.title: 'Naughty Boy' pelican draws in visitors and locals in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: Locals say this cheeky pelican has a personality unlike any bird they have ever seen.

item.title: Australia's peak music exam body under fire amid claims of 'slipping standards'
item.description: It is held up as the "gold standard" of music testing in the country, but there are claims the Australian Music Examinations Board is letting down talented students.

item.title: Snowy Mountains farmers call for support in managing spread of invasive weed African lovegrass
item.description: To the untrained eye, African lovegrass is just another plant in the NSW Snowy Mountains. But this golden plant is a deceptive invasive weed that is choking out the landscape, causing some farmers to leave the land.

item.title: Conservationists worldwide scrambling for alternative funding after USAID cuts
item.description: Citizen science and AI have never been more important to the environment after White House cuts to USAID are felt beneath the waves, a new report says.

item.title: The Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video
item.description: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

item.title: Melbourne teen who died after nut allergy 'let down' by health system, family says
item.description: Four years after a 15-year-old boy died due to a nut allergy, a Victorian coroner is examining if the death was preventable and whether paramedics and doctors at the Box Hill Hospital provided appropriate care.

item.title: Skyhooks guitarist Bob Starkie dies aged 73 after a battle with cancer
item.description: A statement released on Skyhooks' official Facebook page announced his passing this morning.

item.title: Planning to bite into a sweet, juicy mango? Here's what to know about your favourite summer treat
item.description: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

item.title: Victorian coroner determines Mount Buller hiker missing since 2019 is dead
item.description: A Coroner has determined that Niels Gunther Becker, 39, who went missing at Mount Buller in 2019 is dead but that no third party was involved.

item.title: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions of dollars owed in entitlements
item.description: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

item.title: Colin Friels takes on his final stage role in King Lear at Belvoir in Sydney
item.description: Colin Friels, the award-winning actor known for Malcolm and Water Rats, reflects on his 50-year career on stage and screen as he approaches what might be his final role.

item.title: No-bake chocolate and strawberry cake is the ultimate make-ahead dessert - ABC News
item.description: Icebox cakes are retro no-bake desserts made by layering store-bought biscuits and whipped cream. A no-fuss option for summer celebrations, this one can be assembled in 10 minutes and made well ahead of time.

item.title: Best books out in November, featuring Margaret Atwood's memoir and The Mushroom Tapes
item.description: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include a novel that brings to life Britain's only named wind and a new book by the author of The Handmaid's Tale.

item.title: England captain Ben Stokes dismisses 'arrogant' label amid criticism of Ashes Test loss to Australia
item.description: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries Jodie Haydon at The Lodge in Canberra
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries his partner Jodie Haydon in a private ceremony at his official Canberra residence, after details of the wedding were kept top secret.

item.title: Anthony Albanese's wedding ends this 'killing season' with love's triumph
item.description: The two months preceding a wedding are notoriously hazardous. But consider the two months Anthony Albanese has just had.

item.title: Police continue search for missing man Chris Thorne in Melbourne's west
item.description: Police are searching for missing man Chris Thorne, who was last seen in Melbourne's western suburbs last week.

item.title: North Melbourne becomes first AFLW team to win consecutive premierships after clinical grand final showing
item.description: North Melbourne outclasses the Brisbane Lions by 40 points in the AFLW grand final to capture a history-making second consecutive premiership.

item.title: LNP claims victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: The QLD Premier has declared an LNP win in the Hinchinbrook by-election, in what was once a Katter's Australian Party strong-hold.

item.title: Toni Lamond, known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun and My Fair Lady, dies aged 93
item.description: Australian screen and stage actor Toni Lamond was known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun, My Fair Lady, Number 96 and The Last Frontier.

item.title: Meg Lanning hits 73no as Stars down Renegades, Hurricanes defeat Scorchers
item.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning hits 73 not out to help the Stars to a convincing 45-run derby victory over the Renegades, while the Hurricanes down the Scorchers.

item.title: Kangaroos break new ground on the field and in the history books in AFLW flag defence
item.description: North Melbourne proves to be ground breakers and history makers as it extend its match-winning streak to 27 games in a comprehensive win over Brisbane.

item.title: As questions around horse welfare grow, equestrian sport is facing a reckoning
item.description: As questions around horse welfare grow, can equestrian sport's Olympic dream survive?

item.title: Crypto gaming earns users tokens but also exposes them to risks of trading and speculation
item.description: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

item.title: Some sex workers are calling out the lack of transparency in large amounts of viral social media content being targeted at young women.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sex work influencers call out lack of transparency as young girls targeted by viral social media content
item.description: Sex workers say viral social media content, which often promotes a life of luxury, needs to be more transparent to avoid duping young followers.

item.title: Hobart stadium vote will determine future of historic Macquarie Point waterfront and AFL team
item.description: Since its inception, the stadium project has divided the Hobart community in a tug of war between development and preservation of its historic waterfront. In just days, the door will shut forever on one side of the debate.

item.title: The spooky First Nations movie you need to see at BIFF
item.description: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

item.title: Thai PM admits flood failures after trapped victims wait days for help
item.description: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is located.

item.title: Oscar Piastri wins Qatar F1 sprint race, qualifies fastest for GP, edging closer to Lando Norris in standings
item.description: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: Paul Kelly, Stella Donnelly, 5 Seconds of Summer lead November's best new albums
item.description: Sensitive song-smiths, reinvented boy bands, rock and rap upstarts — it's all here in an Ausmusic Month edition of the best new music.

item.title: 'Awareness gap' on mental health support available for new parents
item.description: Nilupulie Karunaratne thought asking for help was a sign of weakness. Then her husband referred her to a psychologist.

item.title: Labor should theoretically be confident ahead of the 2026 Victorian election — but challenges are mounting
item.description: On paper, Labor should be confident that it will score an unprecedented fourth term in office when Victorian voters go to the ballot box in a year's time, with the Liberal opposition still scrambling to present as an electable alternative.

item.title: The Melbourne Metro Tunnel opens today. Here's what you need to know
item.description: It's the biggest upgrade to Melbourne's rail network in more than 40 years, and it's arrived — the long-awaited Metro Tunnel, along with its five new inner-city stations, opens to the public.

item.title: What people with diabetes want you to know
item.description: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

item.title: North Melbourne Kangaroos rally around injured Mia King after AFLW grand final
item.description: During their AFLW premiership celebrations, North Melbourne players make sure to take time for Mia King, who just missed the grand final with a knee injury.

item.title: Chapter closes on 'The Family' murders that stole Adelaide's innocence
item.description: One of South Australia's most notorious murderers was this week rushed to an infirmary on the brink of death, prompting recollections of the time when young males disappeared across Adelaide in a set of gruesome crimes dubbed "The Family" murders. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

item.title: British playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

item.title: Queensland to become first Australian jurisdiction to allow specialist general practitioners to diagnose ADHD in adults
item.description: Queensland is becoming the first jurisdiction in Australia to allow specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in adults and prescribe treatment, but some hold concerns about the lack of mandatory specific training.

item.title: Eli Katoa shares images post brain surgery, pays tribute to partner and hopes for NRL return
item.description: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa shares an update after his brain surgery, posting images of himself in hospital and saying he hopes to return to football "soon".

item.title: Surfers set to pay to ride Fiji's world-class breaks after repeal of surf access law
item.description: Surfers wanting to catch a wave at Fiji's world class reef breaks could soon have to pay for the privilege after the repeal of a beach access law.

item.title: WA Legal Practice Board slammed by lawyers in scathing parliamentary submissions
item.description: In a scathing rebuke of their own watchdog, WA lawyers claim the state's Legal Practice Board is causing them psychological harm amid calls for urgent reform.

item.title: Energy independence? It would reduce the impact of global energy shocks
item.description: If Australia produced 100 per cent of its energy from renewable sources, it would reduce the impact of global energy shocks on Australia's economy.

item.title: Surfers Paradise sand 'island' to disappear by Christmas
item.description: Curious beachgoers are being cautioned to stay off the sandbar and to swim between the flags.

item.title: Coalition floats stronger 'values' test for migrants
item.description: Sussan Ley says migration tensions in Australia are not the fault of migrants, but a stronger "Australian values" test for those seeking to move here could form part of the Coalition's coming migration policy.

item.title: The Austrian heiress giving away her entire fortune
item.description: When Marlene Engelhorn inherited tens of millions of dollars from her grandma, she felt she had two choices: do something about it, or confirm she was "full of sh*t".

item.title: Sydney FC great Alex Brosque fumes over alleged handball in Wanderers' 1-0 ALM win
item.description: Sydney FC's four-match winning streak comes to a crashing halt, but its 1-0 loss to Western Sydney has sparked debate about what constitutes a handball.

item.title: Supporters of proposed Macquarie Point stadium rally ahead of crucial vote
item.description: Supporters of Tasmania's proposed AFL stadium have gathered on Hobart's parliament lawns on Sunday to show their backing of the controversial build.

item.title: Ombudsman calls on NT government to urgently remove prisoners from police cells
item.description: The Northern Territory's prison watchdog has called on the government to urgently remove all inmates from police cells following an investigation which revealed prisoners sleeping between toilets and claims guards watched women showering.

item.description: Creating history by winning consecutive premierships and completing an unbeaten season is just reward for North Melbourne's boundary-pushing AFLW program.

item.description: A plan for the Northern Territory to be among the first places in the world to import foreign carbon emissions has raised fears it will turn Darwin into a global pollution dumping ground.

item.description: Local King Island teen Lusian West, 16, has not been seen since Friday, with Tasmania police and rescue crews to conduct aerial searches of the island's north.

item.title: Em Rusciano on finding balance in life after her ADHD and autism diagnoses

The self-described "maximalist power queen" shares how she unwinds and how her approach to life has changed since going through perimenopause and being diagnosed with ADHD and autism.

item.description: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

item.description: Police arrest 141 people in Newcastle Harbour for alleged marine-related offences during an anti-fossil fuel protest that began on Thursday.

item.description: The inferno-like fire broke out at Kurrajong Street in North St Marys overnight, generating immense heat and a huge eruption that spewed a fireball more than 100 metres up into the sky.

item.description: It is hard to imagine a better end to the prime minister's year than this one, but realists in government know Labor can't continue to ride the wave.

item.description: With AI deepfakes causing confusion and harm online, the federal government tells tech developers that AI content should be clearly labelled, ahead of a National AI Plan due to be released.

item.title: England's Ashes demolition job of Australia in Brisbane's first ever cricket Test match at the Ekka
item.description: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

item.description: As the social media ban comes into effect, experts are worried children and families will be left vulnerable to age verification scams. Here's why.

item.description: Sabrina's father warned her she couldn't make a living from art, but after decades in a sensible job she's now making waves in the world of glass art.

item.description: Australian salad grower Dicky Bill enters administration, putting 180 people out of work before Christmas.

item.title: Complaints to council climb as Brisbane residents deal with stormwater runoff. But whose responsibility is it?
item.description: Runoff from heavy rainfall and poor drainage can cause damage to properties and worsen flooding. So, who's responsible if your property experiences runoff, and what can you do about it?

item.description: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

item.title: F1 standings: Lando Norris, Max Verstappen, Oscar Piastri set for Abu Dhabi decider after Qatar GP
item.description: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the F1 title suffered a hammer blow after McLaren's strategy error in Qatar, but there is still hope. Here's how the Aussie can upset the odds in Abu Dhabi's decider.

item.title: Australia humbled by New Zealand in Dubai rugby sevens finals
item.description: Australia falls to its trans-Tasman rivals in both the women's and men's finals at the season-opening leg of the world series.

item.title: Big haul of 170yo Indigenous artefacts unearthed in North West Queensland
item.description: A stash of Aboriginal artefacts, dating back about 170 years, is unearthed from the red dirt of outback Queensland, bringing history to life for the local Pitta Pitta people.

item.title: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air tv access and facing internet outages
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Opticomm customers across Australia losing free-to-air television and facing internet outages
item.description: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

item.title: Eight ways to drink less during Christmas party season
item.description: If you want to drink less (or not at all) this silly season, you don't have to rely on willpower alone. Having a plan can help.

item.title: WA government commits $109.9 million for preventing family and domestic violence
item.description: The WA government has announced a $109.9 million package to address family and domestic violence (FDV) across the state.

item.title: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says
item.description: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

item.title: Christmas Island's last dog embraced by the remote community
item.description: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate Labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

item.title: Death toll tops 800 as intense storms hammer Asian countries
item.description: At least 355 people are dead and 366 are missing in Sri Lanka as floods, cyclones and torrential rain continue to affect millions of people across Asia.

item.title: Meningococcal B scare prompts call for free immunisation program
item.description: Charlie was in a coma for days after contracting the rare but preventable disease. He was lucky to survive.

item.title: Sensitive parliament communications handed to contractor without security clearance
item.description: The team of a contractor that was the victim of a Russia-linked hack did not have the necessary security clearance when it received thousands of sensitive communications between politicians and parliamentary staff, in a mistake the department has now conceded.

item.title: Summer sleeps in as Melburnians endure coldest December 1 in decades
item.description: Melbourne's temperature is not forecast to rise above 15C today, making it the coldest December 1 since 1996.

item.title: Mourners flock to site of deadly Hong Kong blaze as Beijing warns against protests
item.description: Thousands of people pay tribute to the victims of Hong Kong's deadliest fire in more than 75 years, as Beijing warns it will crack down on any "anti-China" protest in the wake of the blaze.

item.title: Nicola Olyslagers and Bruce McAvaney honoured at World Athletics Awards
item.description: Nicola Olyslagers becomes only the second Australian athlete to be honoured at the World Athletics Awards, while legendary broadcaster Bruce McAvaney is recognised for his contribution to the sport.

item.title: Emerson Jones and James Duckworth receive wildcards ahead of 2026 Australian Open
item.description: Teen star Emerson Jones becomes one of the youngest Australians to receive a wildcard to the Australian Open after stellar performances at tournaments in November.

item.title: How councils are preparing for billion-dollar wind farm projects amid renewables boom
item.description: As approvals for multi-billion-dollar projects land on agendas at country local government meetings, staff and elected representatives battle to ensure their communities are prepared to benefit.

item.title: Geraldton bushfire destroys one home as up to 200 firefighters worked to control blaze
item.description: Authorities have downgraded their warning levels for bushfires burning in the greater Geraldton area to an 'advice' level after a challenging day for firefighters.

item.title: Brett Russell sentenced to 12 years, 9 months behind bars for Victorian school bus crash
item.description: Brett Russell was towing two trailers with faulty brakes at high speed in September 2022 when he crashed into the back of a school bus in regional Victoria.

item.title: South-east Queensland population to reach 4.5 million as growth outpaces that of the nation, KPMG analysis shows
item.description: South-east Queensland's population is set to reach 4.5 million by the time Brisbane hosts the 2032 Olympics, new analysis shows, despite rising property prices driven by a lack of supply.

item.title: Ngangkaṟi share traditional healing in new edition of book that went global
item.description: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

item.title: Government unveils Department of Defence overhaul amid delays and cost blowouts
item.description: Three groups within Defence will be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

item.title: Man pleads guilty to manslaughter of surfer Guy Haymes in Manly
item.description: A man has admitted to fatally bashing a well-known surfer on Sydney's northern beaches during a dispute in which he accused him of stealing $50.

item.title: Tiwi Islands man guilty of murdering international student, NT Supreme Court jury finds
item.description: The man accused of murdering a 23-year-old international student in Darwin in 2023 has been found guilty following a week-long trial in the NT Supreme Court.

item.title: Carbon monoxide leak at Derrimut meat processing plant leaves multiple workers in hospital
item.description: Almost two dozen workers have fallen ill after a carbon monoxide leak at a pork processing plant in Derrimut.

item.title: Trump wants Venezuela's airspace closed — but international law stands in the way
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Venezuela's airspace should be considered closed. According to international law, it's not that simple.

item.title: $3.4 billion Coomera Connector stage one to open after construction cracks probed
item.description: Motorists will be able to use the first 4-kilometre stretch of the new Coomera Connector as an alternative to the busy Pacific Motorway from Tuesday.

item.title: Luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV collapses into administration
item.description: Hundreds of Zone RV employees are out of work weeks before Christmas after arriving at work on Monday morning and being told the bad news.

item.title: Case against teens charged over Adelaide shopping centre stabbing could move to adult court
item.description: Prosecutors are "likely" to consider asking for the case against two teenagers charged over a stabbing — which sent an Adelaide shopping centre into lockdown — to be moved to an adult court.

item.title: Watchdog updates warnings for Ozempic-style drugs over potential risk of suicidal thoughts
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator issues a safety warning over the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviours when taking Ozempic-style drugs.

item.title: NSW government, energy company under fire after native bird habitat cleared for renewables project
item.description: The NSW government's flagship renewable energy project has come under fire after trees containing dozens of hatchlings were cut down.

item.title: Hillcrest jumping castle court case costs sought by Rosemary Gamble
item.description: The operator of the jumping castle at the centre of the tragedy in which six schoolchildren died in 2021 is seeking to recoup potentially "millions" in court costs following her being found not guilty of a health and safety charge in relation to the incident.

item.title: First day of summer delivers record heat in the west, record cold in the east
item.description: Summer has arrived in Australia with a bang, with fire and searing heat in the west, while a sprinkling of snow accompanied record cold temperatures in the south-east of the country.

item.title: Vinnies sends most charity waste to ACT landfill as overall disposal declines
item.description: Canberra's biggest charities dumped almost 600 tonnes of waste last financial year, with the declining quality of donations a key factor in goods ending up as landfill.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Businesses using 'branded identifiers' in SMS messages now need to register them
item.description: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

item.title: Prosecutors call last witnesses in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley
item.description: The jury in the former Innisfail nurse's murder trial has heard more than three weeks of evidence.

item.title: Sam Kerr edges closer to injury return in final Matildas friendly vs New Zealand before Asian Cup
item.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

item.title: Netting on apartment complex did not meet fire resistance code, Hong Kong officials say
item.description: Hong Kong's anti-corruption agency has arrested 13 people, including the directors and an engineering consultant of a construction company.

item.title: Inquest hears man likely experiencing psychosis was carrying fake gun and planning 'suicide by cop'
item.description: An inquest into a 2024 police shooting in Nowra on the NSW South Coast hears police gunned down a man who was carrying a fake gun with the intention of being killed.

item.title: Accountability sought after Hong Kong’s deadly apartment fire
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq sentenced to prison in Bangladesh in corruption case linked to her aunt, former PM Sheikh Hasina
item.description: Tulip Siddiq says the decision should be treated with "contempt", while her political party says she was not afforded due process.

item.title: World Health Organization recommends Ozempic-style medications as long-term obesity treatments
item.description: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

item.title: Flooding in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka kills more than 1,160 people as recovery efforts continue
item.description: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

item.title: Luigi Mangione faces key evidence hearings over US healthcare executive's killing
item.description: Mr Mangione, who was arrested in 2024, has been charged with fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.

item.title: One fire, two systems: Hong Kong's grief meets Beijing's red lines
item.description: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's final mistake and the lonely death of the cocaine king
item.description: More than three decades since his death in a rooftop shootout with police, the legacy of cocaine king Pablo Escobar continues to affect Colombia.

item.title: Tasmanians express mix of views ahead of final Macquarie Point stadium vote
item.description: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

item.title: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to push new developments
item.description: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

item.title: Maps reveal the Ukraine regions Vladimir Putin does not hold, but wants anyway
item.description: Donald Trump is expected to send his special envoy Steven Witkoff to Moscow this week to talk about a revised proposal for peace in Ukraine. There are five regions central to negotiations and Vladimir Putin wants them all.

item.title: Is social media masking bushwalking dangers and leading to poor hiking decisions?
item.description: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

item.title: Tumbling Bitcoin's last useful business — money laundering — under threat from Tether
item.description: It remains a useful tool for some nefarious operators, including global crime gangs and questionable governments, but Bitcoin's role has been usurped by stablecoins — one in particular.

item.title: NDIS cuts Deaf man's Auslan funding, recommends he explore 'other communication methods'
item.description: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

item.title: What 17,000-plus young people think about the social media ban
item.description: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

item.title: Victoria seeks to change 'unconstitutional' donation laws amid High Court challenge
item.description: A financial election advantage for the three biggest Victorian political parties will be removed in the face of a High Court challenge that has argued the state's donation laws are unconstitutional.

item.title: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success
item.description: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

item.title: Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws under National AI Plan
item.description: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

item.title: Why you should read the fine print when purchasing a gift card this festive season
item.description: If you receive a gift card for Christmas this year you might fall foul of "activation rules". Here's how.

item.title: Two men first in SA to be found guilty of charges arising from encrypted devices
item.description: Two South Australian men are the first in the state to be found guilty after standing trial for charges arising from the major police operation.

item.title: R360's postponed launch calls to mind rebel competitions like Super League and World Series Cricket
item.description: R360's announcement it is not going to be ready in 2026 brings back memories of previous attempts to set up rebel sporting competitions, almost all of which have failed.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy eyes talks with Donald Trump on 'key issues' as Steve Witkoff heads to Moscow
item.description: The Ukrainian president meets French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris as he sounds out European allies on Washington's blueprint to end Russia's war.

item.title: Two teenage boys charged over fire at Deniliquin High School
item.description: Two teenage boys have been charged over a weekend fire that extensively damaged Deniliquin High School in the NSW Riverina.

item.title: Uber driver says rideshare app tells workers to flout road rules as bill introduced
item.description: The NSW government introduces legislation that would require employers to ensure their algorithms and automation practises do not risk a worker's health and safety.

item.title: Secret government audit reveals how big travel companies can overcharge clients
item.description: The document, prepared for the Queensland government, has been exclusively obtained by the ABC.

item.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
item.description: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

item.title: Federal politics live: Government to establish landmark probe into ADF sexual violence
item.description: A landmark inquiry into sexual violence in the Australian Defence Force will be announced today. Follow live.

item.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
item.description: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

item.title: Filmmaker breaks decades of silence over Yolŋu clan leader's alleged murder by police
item.description: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

item.title: Pat Conroy on the landmark inquiry into sexual violence in the ADF
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Geraldton resident Nick Morgan grateful for support after losing home in bushfires
item.description: A home owner who lost his house and his cat to a bushfire in Geraldton, in WA's Mid West, says "karma" is looking for anyone who may have deliberately lit the blazes.

item.title: Son of drug kingpin 'El Chapo' pleads guilty in US drug trafficking case in deal with prosecutors
item.description: A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo" pleads guilty to US drug trafficking charges, months after his brother entered a plea deal.

item.title: NT government announces childcare compliance 'crackdown', but providers unsure
item.description: The Northern Territory government has announced a "crackdown" on compliance at childcare centres across the territory, following the death of a toddler at a rural Darwin centre in 2023.
